pages.text: Vault Gear is the main source of $(l)defense$() when entering a Vault.$(br2)It can be $(l)found$() within Vaults or $(l)crafted$() by the player.$(br2)Unidentified Vault Gear can be identified by right-clicking it to reveal its $(l)rarity$() and $(l)model$().
An Identification Stand $(l)fastens$() the $(l)identification$() of Vault Gear.$(br2)The table can be right-clicked to identify any Vault Gear in the player's inventory $(l)at once$().

pages.title: Level
pages.text: $(br)The $(l)higher$() the $(l)level$() of Vault Gear, which scales with the Vault Level when it was found or crafted, the better the $(l)tiers$() of the $(l)modifiers$().$(br2)Vault Gear only protects the player if they are $(l)at or above$() the gear's level.$(br2)The level of Vault Gear can be lowered when combined with a $(l)Banished Soul$() in an anvil.

pages.title: Rarity
pages.text: $(br)The $(l)better$() the $(l)rarity$() of Vault Gear, the more $(l)prefixes$() and $(l)suffixes$() it rolls. $(br2)$(l)Possible rarities$() include:$(li)Scrappy$(li)Common$(li)Rare$(li)Epic$(li)Omega $(br2)A $(l)Scrappy+$() piece of gear may roll its rarity anywhere from Scrappy to Omega.

pages.title: Model
pages.text: Rolling a model for the $(l)first time$() unlocks it for that gear piece.$(br2)After unlocking a model, Vault Gear of that type can be changed to that model in the $(l)Transmogrification Table$() in exchange for Vault Bronze.

pages.title: Legendary Modifiers
pages.text: $(br)When $(l)identifying$() Vault Gear, it may roll Legendary Modifiers randomly. These can $(l)only$() be obtained through identifying Vault Gear, not by modifying it.$(br2)These modifiers are of a $(l)higher tier$() than regular modifiers.
